content:
I'm glad to hear that Lola's doing well! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have personal experiences or relationships, so I didn't know you had a pet named Lola or that you had a vet appointment. But I'm happy to help you with your question!

As for recommending a premium pet food brand, there are many great options available on the market. It's essential to consider your pet's individual needs, such as their age, breed, size, and health conditions, as well as your budget and personal preferences.

Here are a few popular premium pet food brands that you may want to consider:

1. Orijen: Known for their high-protein, grain-free formulas made with fresh, regional ingredients.
2. Acana: Similar to Orijen, Acana offers a range of grain-free and high-protein formulas with fresh, regional ingredients.
3. Blue Buffalo: A popular, high-quality brand that offers a range of life stages and lifestyle formulas, including grain-free and gluten-free options.
4. Merrick: A grain-free brand that offers a variety of formulas with real meat as the first ingredient.
5. Wellness: A natural pet food brand that offers a range of formulas with natural ingredients and no artificial preservatives.

Remember to always transition your pet to a new food gradually to prevent digestive upset. It's also a good idea to consult with your veterinarian for recommendations on the best food for your pet's specific needs.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
